item.title: Animating plots with gganimate and tweenr
item.description: Animation can be added to ggplot() plots using the gganimate package by David Robinson. Using the CSO Statbank API insert link, we can load in a table of population by county in Ireland for each Census since 1841. library(rjstat) library(tidyverse) library(gganimate) library(tweenr) library(scales) census_url <- "http://www.cso.ie/StatbankServices/StatbankServices.svc/jsonservice/responseinstance/EY001" pop_data <- fromJSONstat(census_url) pop_data <- pop_data[[1]] %>% as_data_frame() To look at county populations, filter to both sexes and filter out the total state populations.

item.title: Accessing the CSO Statbank API
item.description: CSO have an API for access to data on demographics and the economy in the Statbank database. The data is made available in JSON-stat format. There is an R package called rjstat , developed by Aaron Schumacher to read and write data in this format. install.packages("rjstat") library(rjstat) library(tidyverse) The website for the API is here. The JSON data is stored in a url comprising a fixed address plus the table code.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Dan Brennan. I am a transport planner with an interest in data analysis and programming in languages such as R, Python and Bash. This website is mainly a collection of my own notes on programming, statistics and data analysis. The site has been built using the R blogdown package.
